title.narrative: NEXT STEP continuation for El Adde schooling development

description.narrative: Somalia's government is not capable to taking care of children and young people in all areas of education. The project's main objective is to try and prevent marginalization of young people by increasing professional knowledge and higher education in El-Ad de which is a sought-after area in terms of educating the ever-increasing youth. The project will prevent the inflow of young people into criminal activity or participation in the civil war by giving the opportunity to attend school and to a better future. The project is in the development of cross-cutting policy objectives. It will reduce inequality and increase equality by giving everyone the opportunity to attend school regardless of their socio-economic status. Schooling is equally possible for different genders and different age groups developing teachers' professional skills and thus raising the level of teaching and curriculum planning that is closer to the European best practices to promote Somali equality in relation to European professional knowledg e which is the key to future competitiveness. This funding application is for the period 2014-2016 for El-Adde school development project.The main features of the project are directed to increase the teaching resources, teaching quality improvement and enh ancement of safety as well as some of the environmental factors. The beneficiaries are primarily young people their family their community and the urban community. Educated young people develop their own community and the effects of education level also af fect the development of the whole of Somalia. During the TEKO project follow-up the idea is to ensure the school graduates and the youth are given the opportunity and potential for further study in their home regions. During the project special attention w ill be paid to teachers' salaries training and curriculum (OPS) development.Professional development of teaching and preparation of OPS is established in collaboration with InnoOmnia and the Universe of Somalia with a view to taking advantage of the Espoo export expertise in training the Somali education system and teaching content area development. Gedo?s safety risks are known well-recognized and analyzed.To improve the safety special considerations will be given by establishing a broader risk management plan and improve the safety of the school through building among other things security fence to protect the school buildings. The plan as a whole is for a full eight year program.
